title: Algorithm Meta-Parameters
technique_description: Search for triggers using Bayesian Optimization for Trojan classification. 1) A Bayesian optimizer proposes potential triggers to try given results from triggers tried so far. 2) Inference the model with the proposed triggers and record model activations. 3) Record triggers tried and model activations as features, and a Trojan classifier is trained to predict whether the model is Trojaned or not given features.
technique_changes: We extracted a fixed trigger search schedule from the Bayesian Optimization model to greatly speed up processing, to better understand the challenges we are facing in sentiment classification and named entity recognition models.

bsz_qa.description: Maximum number of clean examples to use for inference. This is for only the Question Answering models.  Default 12 for improved performance.

bsz_sc.description: Maximum number of clean examples to use for inference. This is for only the Sentiment Classification models. Default 4.

bsz_ner.description: Maximum number of clean examples to use for inference. This is for only the Named Entity Recognition models. Default 4.

budget_qa.description: Number of triggers to try. More triggers might give better performance at the cost of longer run time. This is for only the Question Answering models. Default 5000 to save time.

budget_sc.description: Number of triggers to try. More triggers might give better performance at the cost of longer run time. This is for only the Sentiment Classification models. Default 200000.

budget_ner.description: Number of triggers to try. More triggers might give better performance at the cost of longer run time. This is for only the Named Entity Recognition models. Default 200000.
